definition: lit. heart distracted, thoughts in turmoil (idiom); distraught with anxiety
to feel vexed/to bother/to trouble/superfluous and confusing/edgy
Italy/Italian/abbr. for 意大利[Yi4 da4 li4]
in confusion or disorder/in a confused state of mind/disorder/upheaval/riot/illicit sexual relations/to throw into disorder/to mix up/indiscriminate/random/arbitrary

sentences.english: I'm always upset when I don't get mail.
sentences.chinese: 我接不到晌何邮件时总嗜心烦意乱。

sentences.english: Pete was upset when his pet bird died.
sentences.chinese: 当皮特的宠物鸟死掉时，他心烦意乱。

sentences.english: But the idea of Beaufort gnawed him.
sentences.chinese: 不过一想到博福特，他又变得心烦意乱。

sentences.english: We should not be stirred by rumors of crisis.
sentences.chinese: 我们不应该被危机的谣言弄得心烦意乱。

sentences.english: I found myself upset at my child for just being a child.
sentences.chinese: 我发现自己仅仅因为我的孩子还是个孩子而心烦意乱。

sentences.english: Now don't get distracted. We came here to buy badminton racquets.
sentences.chinese: 现在不要心烦意乱，我们来这里买羽毛球拍。

sentences.english: Mary was fluttered by the sudden news.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽被这个突然的消息弄得心烦意乱。

sentences.english: He didn’t tell me the reason why he was so upset.
sentences.chinese: 他没有告诉我他为什么那样心烦意乱。
她安慰着心烦意乱的泰瑞。

sentences.english: We sometimes do things that are permanently foolish just because we are temporarily upset.
sentences.chinese: 暂时的心烦意乱可能干出永久性傻事。

sentences.english: The comings and goings of the fiacres had greatly agitated him.
sentences.chinese: 那辆马车的忽来忽往早已使他心烦意乱。

sentences.english: She seemed less like a poetess than a distracted housewife.
sentences.chinese: 她似乎不像个女诗人，更像一个心烦意乱的家庭主妇。

sentences.english: There was something else eating at me.
sentences.chinese: 有别的事情扰得我心烦意乱。

sentences.english: Don't be too upset if I say "I hate you."
sentences.chinese: 如果我说“我恨你”，别太心烦意乱。

definition: to feel agitated/to be troubled/to be annoyed/an upset or distraction
variant of 頭昏腦脹|头昏脑胀[tou2 hun1 nao3 zhang4]
one's thoughts in a whirl (idiom); confused/disconcerted/upset
unable to sit or stand still (out of nervousness etc) (idiom)
